result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Lee Roach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,190.00 to Ms. Dorothy S.  To be paid first.

Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  All monies to be taken by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No contact with Ms. Dorothy S.
No contact with Walmart at 10330 W. Silverspring Drive, Milwaukee, WI.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if not previously taken.
The Court advised defendant that as   a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

records.addlTxt: Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, calendar successor, for review. mag
Original Transcript of GUILTY PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING (34 pages) commencing JUNE 22, 2015 received and filed.
Attorney Stewart is out of the office on today's date; another date was selected on 5/29/15.  Case is adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/22/15 at 8:30 a.m.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Anthony Lee Roach not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Kimberly D. Schoepp for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waived her client's appearance; requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Anthony Lee Roach not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties request another scheduling date, as defense counsel indicated she is trying to get appointed on this case as well (she has been appointed in 13CF1273).  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Lee Roach in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Anthony Lee Roach in custody.  Ron Dague for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to a lower pending case.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese Dick on behalf of attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Anthony Lee Roach not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague on behalf of Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defense counsel request adjournment, as attorney of record is unavailable for today's proceeding. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dorothy S.

Defendant Anthony Lee Roach in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Anthony Lee Roach in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
